website_summaries.verdict: Sturdy and water-resistant, this casual watch runs just 2-months shy of a year on a single, full solar charge.
pros: Runs 10 months on a full solar charge without further exposure to light
Solar rechargeable battery, including indicator and power-saving function
5 Daily alarms, 1/100 second digital stopwatch and 2 countdown timers
cons: Date and digital window are too small to read easily

customer_reviews.title: The cost of this watch also gives you good value for your money
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a manly looking analog watch whose battery would last a while before having to replace, and this fit my needs perfectly. The cost of this watch also gives you good value for your money. No quite as large as the typical G shock, but hefty looking just the same...
customer_reviews.author: Richard Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Broken watch band
customer_reviews.text: Band broke from watch after a little over a month and does not stay together when put back together to attempt to fix. Quality does not seem good for attachment area.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Synowka

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointing warranty terms on Casio wrist watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch in April 2019. In late November 2019, the functionality on setting digital time wouldn't work. Casio customer service in informed me if I send the watch to NJ, they will inspect and decide whether warranty covers it. Bottom line is in order to see whether it is covered or not, I will have to potentially pay shipping both ways and probably the repair cost if they decide it is not covered. Apparently, their local retailers in Cincinnati will not provide this service. Good watch, but lousy warranty & customer service.
customer_reviews.author: sam venki

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a bad product, I would never order it after the present experience. The watch looses sync between the analog and digital display at least once a week making it necessary to go though the sync procedure. The hour hand is misaligned. When the minute hand is on 12, the hour hand is about 3 minutes off the hour. I would advise against purchasing this watch
customer_reviews.author: william juaire

customer_reviews.title: Casio makes a great watch. This one has a design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions to set date not easy to follow. Minute hand covers date when time is between 25, 30 and 35 minutes past the hour. The date and digital window is very small... hard to read. The watch face is very large so they could have made that window a bit larger. I returned it... no questions asked... full refund. Now to find the right Casio watch. My husband has owned 3 Casios in the last 30 years... very well made watches.
customer_reviews.author: P Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, but may not for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: Like the fit on wrist. Like analog time display. The digital diaplay for month_date_second, is not intuitive. Took me a while to figure out. Also, the digital display is small. I need to put on glasses to see it. Sometimes one of the analog time finger covers the display panel, making it difficult to see numbers underneath. In wintertime or continuing rainy days, I have hard time to keep the buttery fully charge. However my watch has kept going under "mid" battery level so far for 2 weeks. I think this watch is more suitable for active outdoor person.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Ren

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Gift
customer_reviews.text: The watch is accurate and stylish and I am fond of the additional electronic features such as the alarms, battery indicator and time zones. The price was decent and worth every penny. The digital display illuminates yellow and the analog hands produce a fluorescent green. The watch beeps whenever a button is depressed and the hands rotate automatically once the time is set. The band adjusts easily and is composed of soft rubber. I highly recommend this wrist watch!
customer_reviews.author: Luckicharm

customer_reviews.title: He still wears it because the digital works but thats pretty crappy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband - the analog stopped working a month later. He still wears it because the digital works but thats pretty crappy!
customer_reviews.author: Teanna

customer_reviews.title: Really good quality watch
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality watch! So it has held up very well my the harsh work environment. I've had no problems or issues with this watch at all, and for the price, you can't beat it! I purchased 2 more to give as gifts to friends. It is multi-lingual, which is the main reason I tried this watch. Another good feature is the end of the watchband stays in place and doesn't pop out! It has all of the usual other features, world time, stop-watch, day-date, etc. Just choose your time zone, and it automatically sets it's own time! If it doesn't, just set the digital time to the correct time, and the analog hands will auto-set, simple! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Arellano

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, no problems!
customer_reviews.text: This is a large dial, easy to read, solar charging watch. I've owned a Casio waverider so setting up this one was easy. It needed a day in the window in full sun to charge up initially. I used toothpaste to remove the graphics of "Solar Tough" and "Illuminated" from around the dial. I have not used the timer functions as I have no need for them at this time 😮. It appears to keep excellent time as I would expect of a Casio watch. The price is also very good.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Casio Tough Solar - 5 Years Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch in June of 2014 - 5 1/2 years ago. Except for some of the graphics wearing off (the labels "Tough Solar" and "Illuminator"), this watch has been flawless. I have never had to think about winding, batteries, etc. It just goes and goes. Even the band has held up well. Two years ago I moved from Michigan to South Texas, and the sweat and the heat have not had any deleterious effects. The accuracy is the only minor issue, gaining about 1 1/2 minutes every couple months. Great inexpensive watch.
customer_reviews.author: oinodam

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, multi-function solar-powered watch
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tested its water resistance or some of its multiple functions, but just as a watch it's worked fine and keeps time accurately. It's sturdy, easy to read, and I like the fact that it's solar-powered so I'm not so dependent on batteries (although it obviously uses battery power at night). It's a bit complicated to set up--an inherent problem with multi-function watches--and the little manual prioritizes brevity rather than clarity, but most people should be able to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Guy

customer_reviews.title: This is a Super Watch & At a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned because some of the Casio Tac Watches are garbage. I wanted a back up solar watch and did not care about atomic time in with this model. It is fantastic! Like other reviewers, i will reinforce it is easy to set up, and is easy to read (day or night). It is also surprsingly light but the face is large (2" or 5 cm) if you have small wrists. Fits me perfectly. I have only had it a few weeks but have beat it up pretty good. I think it will last. Takes 6-8 hours in bright natural sunlight to initially fully charge but after that -no worries.
customer_reviews.author: Hap50

customer_reviews.title: Best watch for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch back in 2019. Have always been very impressed with casio and this watch is no exception. I love the ease of setting and if watch is not wore for a while and put in a dark place it is designed to stop working and all hands go to 12 o'clock. Press any button and watch goes back to correct time. Very cool ! Very durable. Can't go wrong if you're looking for a causal watch with dependability.
customer_reviews.author: Hep

customer_reviews.title: Bad Timing With Casio Solar Watch
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally wrote the review for this Casio Solar watch on a previous Casio watch. THIS is the Casio Solar watch we had trouble changing the time on. We tried everything without success. It was very frustrating. We finally gave up and bought a different watch. We wouldn't recommend this watch to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Leona Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Solar, Water Proof to 300" and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have had several, OK, five or six solar watches. Most of the ones still smiling in the sun are my Casios. The majority of the expensive, old watch maker named solar watches; stainless, gold plated, and titanium are now in recycling. This Casio sport model is the least expensive solar watch I've found; especially considering all it does. Is it impossible to set up? Nope just follow the instructions, or look it up online if you want larger print. It's my everyday watch, comfortable band, light weight and no batteries to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch! Says it can go under water but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Watch! Says it can go under water but then comes with instructions stating not to take a shower with it lol? Regardless I work on a farm and the river and put this watch threw some ambuse. Lasted a year guessing cause I worked on the river and submerged it constantly. I still don't understand how it says it can go underwater but you cant take a shower with it. That blows my mind. If you don't work on a farm or river and don't put your watches threw the abuse I do I would think this watch would last you many years.
customer_reviews.author: TheGreenfarmboy

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: A little on the large side, but not bad. It dug into the front of my wrist, but if I loosened it helped. My issue is very hard to read it the triangles are not luminous and the minute hard is also hard to read at night. World time is nice. Light works ok, but if you need glasses forget about it. Price was excellent and I wanted to like it, but I probably will keep it as a back up if my other Casio stops working.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hinz

customer_reviews.title: Love the solar power....
customer_reviews.text: My work watch, comfortable, keeps good time, light weight, great luminous hands, face. The instruction manual is terrible, print so small could not read it with a magnifying glass, instruction makes no sense, evidently transcribed from a foreign language.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Great watch with a great price
customer_reviews.text: First thing you notice is the weight. since there isn't a battery the watch is very light weight. Buttons are easy to use, I have an earlier G-Shock and the concave buttons were hard to get to. Only con is light does not illuminate the digital portion or the digital portion is too small to read with only the light. Also the analog face does not stay glowing to see at night. But that's common with analog watches. All in all the price and quality of this watch is very good. I am glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good watch for the price, the strap does feel like cheaper material than a gshock but it's fine. Love that it's powered by the sun so no need for replacing batteries. Very sporty design, it's a true black, not light black, and the parts that look greenish in the product images are actually a nice white that makes the watch's design pop. I personally hoped it would be white & not green since it glows in the dark (another cool bonus) but on a bright day it shows up as white.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this watch and I am critical about my watches. Here are my only two minor issues: the illumination only works for the digital area with is very small. So basically without my glasses, I can't see the display. The digital area can display the day of the week and the month/date but not both together. It's probably too small for that. This being said it's a great watch and I would certainly buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works just like a $500~$5000 watch!
customer_reviews.text: I had an expensive watch until now. But i wanted something more versatile and something I don't ever have to change the battery on. I spent $38 including tax and looks/feels great! Water proof, solar powered, stopwatch, alarm, light, unbreakable, and waterproof! I couldn't ask for more. I don't ever have to worry about getting scratched or stolen, I'll just buy a new one for $38 again! lol
customer_reviews.author: Jae and sika

customer_reviews.title: Alarm is TOOOOO soft!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for the alarms, but once I figured out how to set the time, sync digital and analog times, and set any alarm, I realized that the alarm was impossible to hear. In case it was related to the solar power, I put it into the sun for a day to change the battery strength from "mid" to "high". The alarm sound was still indistinguishable. I should have done a bit more research before the purchase. I'm now looking for a watch with a vibration style alarm.
customer_reviews.author: eusrIMHO

customer_reviews.title: Defective???
customer_reviews.text: I liked the way it looks, but tried to set time for California and since its automatic, the time is different, i search for many countries and areas in USA but nothing, the closest to the correct time is one hour behind, so every time i see my watch i have to add an hour which i think i look dumb when someone asks me for the time. One time i forgot if it was to add or substract and yes, i substracted and people were like noooo, cant be that early.. shhhhht so embarrasing
customer_reviews.author: alfredo vergara

customer_reviews.title: Great watch. The solar function is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: For the money you can't beat this watch. I went on vacation and left it behind, so it was in a drawer. Two weeks later put it on to go to work and it was blank and the time was defaulted to 12:00. Walked out in the sun and it self adjusted the time, both digital and analog, once the light hit it. None of my other more expensive watches do that. Watch is ultra light and doesn't add any noticable weight to my wrist. Very happy with this watch and hope it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would Be Great... If It Weren't So Uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This watch has the most uncomfortable band I've ever experienced, and that's saying something, coming from a history of dirt cheap watches. Whether or not the band is replaceable, I'm unsure, as the setup looks nothing like any other watch band I've ever seen. That said, the watch itself works well and works like it's supposed to. Unfortunately that doesn't matter if it's so uncomfortable you can't stand to wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Just about the perfect everyday watch
customer_reviews.text: Just about the perfect everyday watch. Analog, so it's easy to read. It's solar, so no more battery buying, swapping, and disposal. Easy to swap between time zones digitally in seconds (for my travels) - and then the watch moves the hands FOR you! Digital calendar, pre-programmed to 2099 - no more adjusting dates 6 times every year (or getting the date wrong). Wide, beefy band, and recessed dial to keep scratches to a minimum. Plus all the usual digital goodies - stopwatch, alarms, timers. I'm amazed at all it does. It's on the Gift List for my nephews. The Dial Window appears to be plastic, yet I gave it five stars for the nice price.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Good work watch
customer_reviews.text: I work in the trades and don't want to spend a lot of money on a watch that will break. I had an identical model watch for several years and decided I was pretty happy with it. Other than it being a few minutes fast, the problem was the band was wearing out. So here we are with another one. The only thing I really don't like about this watch is the digital display is very difficult to read, and the lighting is very poor. But what can you expect for a less expensive watch?
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: Great watch. I have found Casio watches are usually pretty great. Got this for my son and he said it works great, no problems, and the solar charging works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Manning-Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Bad display at night
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully you won’t ever need this watch in the dark, because the glow in the dark hands only work for about 10 minutes and the tiny digital display that can be lit is almost impossible to read. Also doesn’t display the date properly (it shows the day and seconds but not the month). Overall one of the worst watches I’ve owned. Considering sending it back. But there’s not many analog solar watches out there.
customer_reviews.author: Rick D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Read and Reliable.A Classic Casio, Ingenious and Well Executed.
customer_reviews.text: Clear and easy to read. A bit intimidating to set, if you aren't used to Casio. I suggest you start by making sure that the analog hands are correct (see page 43 of the manual). Although it's not a G-Shock, it still has a Tough Solar movement. I bought it because the day of the week display is really large and clear and it's light-powered. if you want to enlarge the instruction manual to 8.5 inch by 11 inch paper, the magnification you need is 315%.
customer_reviews.author: aquinas

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Once you figure out how to adjust the time for your area it works great, I understand why some people say it doesn't work or is off on the time, because its very difficult to figure out how to adjust the time zone and analog settings. I almost gave up until I figured it out. Now Im as happy as a clam!
customer_reviews.author: My kids are ready

customer_reviews.title: Descent Good looking
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice watch. Great that it's solar. Looks good & is comfortable. Cons: Numbers are small in window. Can be difficult to see in low or no light for some. Glow on hands don't last long. Night time reading is difficult. When this one dies I wouldn't buy it again for those reasons. Overall it is a decent watch. My job & hobbies kills watches fast. This has lasted 3 months without issue. Was buying EXPENSIVE Fitbits. None of them lasted more than a yr..one only lasted 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Smith

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are useless, will not set correct time or date.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions for this watch do not work as shown in the manual. Time settings are off by at least 2 minutes, and then it will go back to an incorrect time. Date settings also don't work. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: KayakerNC

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, but needs regular access to sunlight.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch for the price! I bought it for use in law enforcement as I don't like to spend a lot of money on things like watches that might get torn up. It has everything I need: analog and digital times, date, alarms, stop watch, date, etc. Easy to use and read. The only warning I have is since this is a solar powered watch, it needs regular access to sunlight. The instruction suggests about 10-minutes a day. If you don't work in the daylight, just make sure it gets the recommended exposure. The watch will shut off features as the battery approaches discharge, but the analog time will work until the battery dies.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyG

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great , never needs a battery, easy to read, has lots of functions, looks good as a sport watch, and not very expensive However the wristband is made out of a rubber plastic material and broke after a few years. I was able to buy a replacement band but it very hard to put on. I finally gave up and just bought this new watch.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great watch..
customer_reviews.text: After trying many different big faced, multi functional, microwave size wrist watches, this is the watch for me! Simple and easy to use. Looks great and is solar powered. Big hands and numbers. Small lighted digital screen for date, day, stop watch. Watched an easy youtube video to set the time & date. No problem. After many searches, this is exactly what I wanted and is way less than the price of a G Shock. Excellent watch!
customer_reviews.author: zeebop9

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch, but may require some patience in learning how to use it!
customer_reviews.text: very nice watch; easy to read and comfortable to wear. Con: at the outset it is difficult to figure out all of the nuances to be able to use all of the capability. Directions were not particularly well written and the instruction book could not have used smaller type (well maybe) and it is hard to read. Anyway after a few days of messing with it and just before deciding to return it I was able to figure out the adjustments etc. That having been accomplished I am now quite pleased with my purchase. If you tend to be short on patience you might consider a different watch.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Window is too small
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and features of this watch. However, I wanted to be able to use the stopwatch when I exercise. I wear glasses and my current digital watch is easy to see without glasses, but the window that shows the stopwatch on this watch is way too small to see without putting on my glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Funkhouser

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for small arms
customer_reviews.text: This watch overall looks good, functions fine, and will likely last someone a long time with its solar recharging capabilities. However, when I wore it, it squeezed my wrist too much; instead of shaping around my wrist like a circle, it shaped more like an oval and was always uncomfortable to wear no matter what level of tightness I adjusted it to.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but does not illuminate
customer_reviews.text: NIce watch but you need to go to a training class to learn how to set the many functions, including basic time. I found a video on youtube but the guy giving the instructions had such a heavy foreigh accent, that I could hardly understand him. Frustrating. Once set, it appears to function as advertised. One disappointment, the light does not illuminate the watch, just the microscopically tiny digital time display. No way I could read that even with my glasses on. Nice watch but I want something I could read in the dark, and the light does not get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: CAD

customer_reviews.title: Still Ticking!
customer_reviews.text: It's been about 6 months since I bought this watch and it's awesome! I use it to lift weights, backpack, and just an everyday work watch. I work in a hospital contacting patients all day and I like that it's so easy to clean. Recently I 'lost' it, I looked around for it for a few weeks. One day when we had a warm up and the snow melted I found it at the bottom of a snow bank, after the arctic -20 below and it was still ticking with exact time!! *not a paid review*
customer_reviews.author: Justin Latva

customer_reviews.title: Watch
customer_reviews.text: Instructions left something to be desired, but once set it is a good watch. My only complaint is the seconds feature. It is next to the date and makes it confusing to read. Either have the date or move the seconds feature to another location.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest L Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: I Did Not Like It...So I'm Gifting It
customer_reviews.text: I just didn't like the fact that it had no traditional crown / adjustment knob. The illumination is OK, but why Casio did not illuminate the entire face of the watch makes no sense. On the positive side, it is solar powered and I know my son will enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: It's large - not a "dressy" thing. Like me.
customer_reviews.text: Everything I wanted when my ancient 12 year old Casio died (3 batteries only in all that time). The hands are easy to see in the dark. I have no complaints whatsoever. It's been out in sine downpours and-am roadtrippingto the west coast in 5 days for some waves. I am sure I'm looking forward to a beautiful relationship 👍 Pro tip: if you use cloud storage like dropbox or google, download the watch manual from Casio and save it to cloud. You'll thank me 6 years from now.
customer_reviews.author: carmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, not very waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Not very waterproof, took it to a lake for a weekend and it died, even though I was well above 10m the entire time. I've had 2 die on me, the first was just from swimming in a 6ft pool. Very gladI got the warranty on the second watch, which they couldn't fix, they just sent me a reimbursement, which doesn't actually fully cover the price of a new one; at least I got $35 back from the warranty. I love the watch, its great other than waterproofing, that needs some serious work. i used it as my daily work watch for 2 years, and it's great, everything but its supposed to be waterproof!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of features, no battery worries.
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I had the instruction manual to get started, but now that I have gone through it once, I don't think I will need the manual any more. But you might want to keep yours handy because I've never had any problems setting the clock on my VCR. It has a pretty good set of features, dual time zones, 3 alarms, two chainable timers, stopwatch, and it's solar so I'm hoping I'll never have to change batteries. My only two gripes, when the hands are pointing down, it is hard to read the display. Also, it is larger than I expected. But it seems watches now are bigger than they used to be back when people used VCRs.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband who works in dirt and building and various other things. He is HARD on watches. it has had some rubbing off but is still in great shape a month or so after he started wearing it. He loves it and is thrilled with it. I would buy it again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hershberger

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a alternativewatch to wear while hiking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a alternative watch to wear while hiking, camping, hunting, etc. So far it works great - I don't really use all the features though. I just needed a watch that is durable, waterproof and can withstand the wear and tear of being active outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Start your return right now if you purchase this watch
customer_reviews.text: Horrible watch! Do not waste your time and spending your money on the solar powered watch which is not easy to read or does not show adequate light as advertised. I never sent an item back so quickly because of such inferior quality.
customer_reviews.author: dajfed2038

customer_reviews.title: Incredible watch for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised when I opened this. I was expecting a lot less quality, but it's just as sharp and bold as much more expensive Gshocks I've bought. It is much lighter than those watches, so I question its durability, but unless it outright quits in the first year, for the cost, I'll be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch For Price Point!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Has solar power, easy to set up. Night readability is not great but I simply put my digital readout on time during the night and press the light button. Time will tell on durability but at this moment I would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: GoEasyMan

customer_reviews.title: Tough-looking watch with great functionality, idea for medium-thin wrists.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: -Excellent build quality. -Packed with features. -Great value for money, very inexpensive. -Light! This thing is not heavy and bulky like the classic G-Shock series. -Medium sized; excellent for thin-to-medium wrists. Usually, "tough" shell watches are huge and often look silly when warn by anyone other than those with large wrists. -Digital display powers down to conserve battery power when watch is placed on it's face, blocking all light. CONS: -The strap, though strong and functional, exudes a cheap feel. -Cramped digital display at the bottom. -Not a dual-time clock, for those who travel.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket 455

customer_reviews.title: Simple, functional watch at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Simple, effective watch. Great for the price. The raised plastic pieces help to prevent scratching when the inevitable scrapes and scuffs occur. Would like to see a date feature, but this is by no means a deal-breaker. Comfortable band with plenty of space for any wrist size. I use it for outdoor activities as well as in the gym, and I find that the size is a little big for the gym as it can at times impede the extension of my wrist - so be aware. Having said that, the countdown timer and stopwatch are extremely useful for training. For ~$33 dollars, I don't think I could find a more efficient and functional watch than this.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Buffalo

customer_reviews.title: Don't touch this worthless junk
customer_reviews.text: Down grading my review to Don't touch it;. Froze up at some mythical time when DST was switched off. Jammed and cannot be recovered. The instructions are printed in a six-point font, and is a poor translation from some oriental language. Therefore, unusable. I'm switching back to my old $20.00 battery Casio. Up date: Tried once again to revive the POS. Gave up and threw it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Big-T

customer_reviews.title: Great Solar Watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Husband for Christmas. He had wanted a watch that he could wear to work, this is the perfect watch for that. It’s a perfect construction watch, rugged and solar so no batteries to replace. When setting the time on the watch you just pick the time zone and the watch hands automatically go to the correct time! Great watch, very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not a nice watch.
customer_reviews.text: The watch works well and tells time but it’s really cheaply made. It’s a bit of a pain to set the time but once it’s set it seems to keep time well. I bought it about 3 months ago and it’s holding up just fine. The strap is plastic and a bit stiff for my taste. I like the solar function. It’s really light and feels cheap. I eventually gave it to my 9yo. To me 1 star means hated it, 2 means didn’t like it, 3 means liked it or it was ok, 4 means liked it a lot, 5 means loved it and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Sheneman

customer_reviews.title: Casio Disappoints
customer_reviews.text: The solar powering is a good convenience. The 5 alarm settings feature is kind of ridiculous. To improve this watch have a light button that lights up the time not just the date, then the word "illuminator" on the watch would make sense and one could check the time in the dark. The manual is also ridiculous. Matchbook size and totally inconvenient to unfurl and read. I should have shopped around.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Setting watch is not intuitive.
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks good, but setting the watch is not intuitive. Even though the watch has a dial, the hands have to be set electronically, and you do not set the time but the time zone you live in. The instructions were in very small print and hard to read. I will have to stash the instructions somewhere, because if I use the watch in a different time zone I will be lost. If I knew it was going to be this much trouble adjusting all of the settings, I would probably have looked somewhere else. On the positive side, it is a good looking watch, and it is solar powered, And it was inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh R. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Good solar power, a real puzzle to program
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, reliable watch. A couple of caveats, though: Programming the thing is a real ordeal. There is no stem to change the time on the hands. You have to do it electronically, You set the digital time, and the hands move correspondingly. However, my minute hand is always a couple of minutes fast, so I have to set the digital time a couple of minutes slow. And it's still hard to get the hands to the exact accurate time. BTW, you can download the manual from the Casio web site. You'll need it to figure out how to set the thing. It's real complicated. Six years of hard wear, and it's still going strong. Amazing?
customer_reviews.author: Professor

customer_reviews.title: Keeps resetting to 1/1/2005
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this watch in March of 2016. It worked great and I loved the way it would sync time. Approximately three months ago it started resetting itself to 1/1/2005 and a different time. Each time that I would force it to sync the sync would last a shorter and shorter time. It got to the point that it was resetting daily. I looked online and found that a lot of others were having the same trouble and that Casio had no fix for it. Today it went into the trash. I would highly suggest that you research this watch on other web sites before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Retired

customer_reviews.title: Good solar watch for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, as long as you can read an easy to read manual. It helps if yo have had sport watches before, all are very similar setups. I am pleased, recommend for a good everyday casual watch.
customer_reviews.author: Recon4GW

customer_reviews.title: Great watch Looks pretty good as well Gotten it wet ...
customer_reviews.text: Great watch Looks pretty good as well Gotten it wet several times without any issue. The watch band is rubber but I like that, others may not. Fits great and the band fastens with no effort and stays on. Why I like it Good price (Almost disposable at $30) Great look Can get wet and no issue with watch or band Solar powered ( Only had it for 3 months so hard to tell if this will be good) When you adjust the time it adjusts digital and analog at the same time Cons Not super easy to change date, time etc Instructions are small but that is the same for most watches
customer_reviews.author: Making it in the world

customer_reviews.title: the light?
customer_reviews.text: this is the worse light, on any watch I ever seen. but other than that the watch is a watch. but the light only lights up the small little digital displace screen, not the whole face. I was/Am disappointed - but only $30 - not that bad of a watch. I'll live.
customer_reviews.author: CMJONES

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for 10 y o Casio solar watch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch as a replacement for a 10 year old Casio solar watch. The old watch is still working but very scratched up by normal wear and tear. The nighttime illumination of this new watch is better than the old one. The digital readout is too small but not an issue for me. It's a struggle to set the watch to the proper time zone but I'm digitally challenged! I hope this one holds up as well as the last one. Really like the solar power that eliminates the need for battery changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: Still running after years
customer_reviews.text: Holds a charge a ridiculously long time when not in use. Has an idle mode where the hands stay at 12 o'clock and the LCD is off. Once light shines on the face, it comes to the current time automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Kilpert

customer_reviews.title: Weak not tough
customer_reviews.text: It is called tough solar but not very tough. The face of mine cracked, rendering it no longer water resistant. 15 days after I could no longer return it. If you work for a living, save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Boke Jones

customer_reviews.title: Adjusting the analog hands to local time.
customer_reviews.text: The watch is light weight, comfortable to wear. Adjusting the hands to the local time is a nightmare. The instructions for this procedure, which most purchasers would need to do to use the watch, is difficult to comprehend and to follow. It is a good example of many other CASIO and other brands where a watch most people purchase to check the time, set an alarm, has so many other features crammed into the product that the small size, badly structured and not well written instruction leaflet just can't handle. Unless the buyer like to spend hours with puzzles, this watch is not for him.
customer_reviews.author: pleasant19

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful lookingwatch and so light
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful looking watch and so light ! Looks like a more expensive dive watch. The alarm is pretty loud and the solar feature is terrific. Leave it in a drawer and it looks DOA when you take it out,, then exposed to light, it resets everything correctly. The lighting should be like the Timex blue background light, but it is not, so you se the digital but not the analog unless you do the hand reflecting thing. There are other variations of this watch on Amazon and they are all great for the beach and knocking around,, how much do you have to lose if something happens :)
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: This watch is super tough actually
customer_reviews.text: This watch is super tough actually. Almost everyday use, taking care of my two young boys, multiple kinds of house work, building a deck, stairs patios, painting, concrete work, moving my shed, etc. The decals on front wore off, but after 4 years of hard use still strong and wearing it right now with no complaints, actually tougher than my $300 watches for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: This watch was made for me: 5 alarms, timer and dual digital/analog features!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing watch, I use the five alarms to get my kids up for school and keep track of meditation and the solar function is working great! The timer is awesome when I cook, I no longer need to track down the egg timers (we use them to keep track of how long the kids read And how long they're on screens) plus I just love the dual digital/analog feature!
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: This is very annoying. The "light" button doesn't light up the dial
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have a stem, when you select your time zone digitally, the analog automatically moves to the correct time. Solar powered, so when you pull it out of the box, the hands start spinning. It is just powering up. Very lightweight, hard plastic case and band, not really rubber. Upper right "light" button will dig into the back of your hand, especially if you put your hand into a "push-up" position. This is very annoying. The "light" button doesn't light up the dial, only the the very tiny digital display. Want to know what time it is in the dark, well you are out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Ramjet

customer_reviews.title: ... once you get it set this watch is really great. Call the toll-free number provided and ask them ...
customer_reviews.text: It is very difficult to set but once you get it set this watch is really great. Call the toll-free number provided and ask them how to set the watch. I tried to search YouTube to figure out how to set the watch on my own by way of instructions on YouTube and was unsuccessful. So call the toll-free number that comes with the watch for help.
customer_reviews.author: afunkydamsel

customer_reviews.title: Water got into watch with very little exposure
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my son in December. He really liked it. So he has enjoyed it for 7 months or so. But then it went into some very shallow water briefly and now the watch has stopped working and you can see condensation inside the face of the watch. I'm quite disappointed in Casio as the watch says water resistant to 10 bar on the back. It really should say, "don't get this watch wet at all or you are in for trouble."
customer_reviews.author: Just a normal fellow

customer_reviews.title: A decent and cheap lightweight solar watch
customer_reviews.text: A cheap solar sport watch. I like solar watches. This one is reakky lightweight. I prefer the traditional time presentation over the digital one,another advantage of this watch. I need it for hiking and bike riding. The non-detachable band keeps the watch from accidental drop during wearing a backpack. Don't know how durable that watch is, however,I mean how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Yigal Balta

customer_reviews.title: A little bigger face
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little big for women’s wrists but I always liked solar watches. I didn’t want to pay $100+ for my third one so I decided to go with this one. So far it’s as good as more expensive tough solar. Less functions but I don’t use most of them anyway.
customer_reviews.author: arimay

customer_reviews.title: Not "Tough" Enough
customer_reviews.text: I kept the watch near a light source for a few days while I read the instructions. When I finally attempted to set the watch there was no power and the digital display was blank. I am sending it back through the convenient return process. Maybe the watch was broken before being sent or maybe it was loaded next to a crate of magnets during the shipping. Either way, it was a dud when I got the watch. I am giving two stars because the return process seems well thought out. .
customer_reviews.author: k. n. kane

customer_reviews.title: Good watch for daily use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my brother. He’s been using it since I got it for him. Battery last long, He hasn’t change the battery yet. Good sporty look and he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Warlito

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised. I like that it charges with solar. It is alittle big in my opinion. I am very active during work and the large clock face digs into the top of my hand at times and can be uncomfortable. It's definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch at a good price. It has a lot of features and is generally easy to use. I wear it in the pool with no problems, and I've not had any issues with the solar cell keeping it fully charged. My only complaint is that it doesn't have a second hand. The seconds are displayed on the digital screen, which is not very big.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Byers

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Generally am a watch lover and I have different kind of watches and different brands. I love this watch as it fits great on my hand and also I use this watch during my workouts, sometimes for swimming and also wear it casually to office or at home, feels great and also doesn't feel heavy. Coming to the time zone options that are given in the watch, the options are great. I was able to set the respective time zone when I was travelling to Dubai, India and UK. So far I loved this watch and since this does not have any battery and works with solar I dont have to worry about changing the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Santhosh

customer_reviews.title: Nice Watch For Price
customer_reviews.text: As I am getting up in age, I appreciate the size of the dial and ease of reading. The 12-3-9 and hands are painted with luminous material, making it very easy to read in low light. The light feature is pretty much useless, depending upon which mode the digital portion has been set. About the only really important thing is to follow the directions for setting up the watch exactly. I inadvertently skipped a step and messed up my day/date function. It can be corrected by putting the watch in a dark place until the battery runs down and then starting from scratch on the setup. One of those things I feel really dumb when I missed the step.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: G-shock performance without the sticker shock...
customer_reviews.text: Kudos to my son - he wanted a G-Shock until he saw how expensive they are, how HUGE they are on your arm, and how complicated their watch faces are. He found this and thought it a better fit for him - both literally and figuratively. It has plenty of features he will never use, is "Tough", but not G-shock tough, which he doesn't need. I really like the solar part of it - these Casio passive solar batteries last for years, over a decade for my one G-shock. He like it, I like it and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: P. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work after a few months of light use
customer_reviews.text: Spend a little more and get a g shock. I loved this thing for the first few months when it kept time. After a while it just stopped keeping the right time and would not auto adjust when choosing the time zone. Really disappointed because I thought Casio was better quality than that. A friend had the exact same problem with his shortly after he purchased it because he liked the one I had.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler McDonald

customer_reviews.title: great watch that can take abuse
customer_reviews.text: I bought the watch for my husband for Valentine's Day and he loves it. I waited with posting this review, because I wanted to see, how it will hold up over time. My husband abuses the watch on a daily basis by immersing it into water and frequently banging it due to his job. So far he has no problems and it works great. Some reviews complain about how difficult it was to set up, but I have to disagree. He had it up and running in no time. I love the way it looks as well, it's a nice sports watch - true to the picture. The watch looks definitely more expensive then what I paid for!
customer_reviews.author: maleas

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks nice, and due to its synthetic construction weighs next to nothing. There are a few items that keep it from a 5 star product. From the picture shown, it looks like the mini display (and I do mean mini) reads the day and date, but instead it is the day and seconds since there is no second hand. Secondly, the display and the analog time from what I understand should be the same since that is how you set the watch, mine is off 3 minutes. Lastly, who really needs 5 alarms? If you want an inexpensive, nice looking watch this is it, but remember you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bink

customer_reviews.title: Great watch at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I wear this watch to work everyday and it's fairly durable. Haven't had any problems with charge so far. I use the base it came with as a charging stand in the window. Looks good and isn't too bulky. It took a bit of reading of the instructions and fiddling to figure it out but I'm pretty much acclimated to using the watch. Alarm is great for waking up but good when already awake and using it for other things. I'm not a huge fan of the seconds always running in the digital display, but everything else is great. Would recommend this watch for outdoor activities/ work. Also looks good in casual wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Moniz

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. Large face but not "overwhelming". Very light for its size. As others have described the user manual is not the most user friendly one I have seen, as it has small pages and you need to keep flipping back and forth in the manual to set city, adjust time, set alarm, etc.. It was not that difficult, and took very little time to set this watch up. I wear it mainly indoors at work with very little outside sun exposure, but it has kept a strong HI charge without any effort. Very good value for the price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: short1spoke

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive watch for discerning gentlemen
customer_reviews.text: Great watch...after having two or three watches go dead I decided to give this solar a try. It works very well and only the biggest doucher watch snobs won’t like it. Very durable and cheap enough you won’t care if it gets wrecked. The luminescent hands don’t glow very long however.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so far pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I have used this watch for my trips to Costa Rica and Texas fishing trips; so far NO leaks and easy to change time zones by choosing the cities digitally and the analog moves back and forth! great deal for around $30...and it looks great and professional
customer_reviews.author: Suede19

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read dial, accurate time. Solar power.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is light weight, secure on my wrist and keeps accurate time. The bright white numbers, markers and hand tips make seeing the time very easy. Date numbers are small in the digital window, but I can focus on the info well enough for me. The instructions are ok, but all of the Casio watches take some getting used to. I am very satisfied with this watch, especially at the price. I returned several other watches costing hundreds.
customer_reviews.author: TLK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read for oldsters.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to see and read for us old peeps. Although its a little larger than most, it is very light and comfortable to wear. Since Im out in the sun most days, it stays on "hi" charge all the time, and is very accurate so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good basic watch
customer_reviews.text: I like the analog feature of this watch. The digital part is very hard to read under normal conditions, so I'm not using many of the functions. Using these various functions is not very intuitive, so you'll need to keep the user guide handy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I'm disappointed in this watch. Others may not find my issue to be relevant, but I find the watch unreadable in most light. Full disclosure: I am legally blind. I wanted a large, high contrast dial with a meaningful luminescence. This watch misses that mark. Even when I press the backlight button, the dial is still unreadable for me. In fairness, the watch does everything else it is supposed to do, and in bright light, as in direct sunlight, I can read the dial well. Indoors is another matter for me. So, if you are looking for a hi-vis timepiece, this may not be it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Slone

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, this product not user friendly. I always need video or something reference to set or view something. I don't recommend for anyone who don't have time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Casio is awesome...but this one isn't my fav
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of the Casio F-91W old school watch (one of the biggest selling watches on Amazon) but wanted something a bit "more." So I grabbed this one. The problem is that it's just a bulky, cheap, but less hipster version of the other Casio I had. I'd say due to the size and materials used in this...stick with the cheaper, smaller, but more functional F-91.
customer_reviews.author: Breezer

customer_reviews.title: very Tough and long lasting watch.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. The first one lasted for 6 years of wet construction work and abuse. The band finally broke but the watch still works well. Velcroed it to my trucks dash so I could still get a lot more use out of it. Tough watch and I’ve never had to replace the battery.
customer_reviews.author: 3 Three deuces

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice, and well-priced watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, and well-priced watch. It's light, not overly large and relatively versatile for a limited function watch. Set up and operation are easy and it looks like it will survive average use around the house, a shop and outdoor activities. The material is comfortable against the skin and there are enough holes on the band that most folks should find a comfortable fit. Time will tell how well the rechargeable battery holds up, but the solar recharging is exactly what I was looking for in a basic, durable watch. Ultimately this is exactly what I was looking for: a tough, accurate and durable watch.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron S.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy but I'd change some things
customer_reviews.text: Easy to adjust and the manual explains things simply enough as long as you learn what buttons are what although it's kinda small. The solar charged up from Mid to Hi in about two days and hasn't changed since. Been nervous about the glass when getting hit but so far I've dinged it on metal pipes a few times and not even a scratch but I've only had it for a little while so who knows about next month. Also I wish all of the white markers had a glow at night not just 3,6,9&12. Overall I'd say it's worth it as long as you're not wearing it on hard labor jobs where it can get banged up a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kail

product_meta.title: Casio Men's Solar Sport Combination Watch
product_meta.description: Born from a dream of "creating a watch that never breaks." It was over 30 years ago, a CASIO engineer won the battle against the laws of nature. He designed a watch that would resist centrifugal and impact forces, as well as high water pressure. Since then, the name G-SHOCK has become a byword for independence and pushing the limits. G-SHOCK watches are the most durable digital and analog-digital watches in the industry, trusted by military personnel, law enforcement, surfers and outdoor enthusiasts around the world. Along with this, G-SHOCK is highly touted in the fashion world, worn by icons in hip-hop, sports, and design. With limited edition collaborations being released often, you can always find a G-SHOCK that matches your personality and style.
feature_bullets: Tough Solar Power, 100M Water Resistant, LED Light with Afterglow, Neo-brite luminous hands and markers
World Time, Multi-lingual Day of Week display (English, Portuguese, Spanish, French, German, Italian)
5 Daily Alarms, Hourly Time Signal, 1/100 second digital stopwatch, 2 Countdown Timers, Full Auto Calendar, 12/24 Hour Formats
Button operation tone on/off, Storage Battery: Solar Rechargeable Battery, Battery Power Indicator, Power Saving Function,
Approx. battery life: 10 months on full charge (without further exposure to light)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
